data.title: Stopped in for a beer
data.text: The space was great it really lent itself to friends and family atmosphere.  The young lady working the counter was friendly but didn't really know the beer.  She kept looking up stuff about beer on her phone.  That being said she was gracious and attentive towards us.  The problem was the beer that my husband got, a whiskey Porter was flat.  Mine was a good stout.  No food so can't speak to it.  You have a 50/50 chance of getting a good or not so good beer.

data.title: this ISNT EVEN A RESTARAUNT
data.text: How does a beer brewery end in the top 20 Restaurants in our city when it DOESN'T EVEN SERVE FOOD?!?!?!?!?!?!

data.title: Very cool atmosphere and great beer
data.text: This place used to be a fire station, which makes the atmosphere super cool! Their tables are part fire hydrant and they can open up these giant garage-door-style doors which turns their indoor space into an outdoor space.  Also, they have delicious, locally-brewed beer!  And they have a surprisingly large selection of beers to taste, which are all different and unique.  You must visit this place at least once! Especially around sunset.  The view of the sunset is awesome.

data.title: Excellent craft brews!
data.text: This local craft brew started in the basement and has become a gotta get some. Ben and Ben (owners) have a small BUT a very up and coming brewery. Currently have four kettles and plans for twelve more. My wife loves the Louisiana Amber and Barrel 52. I love the Barrel 52 and Black Heart.  I can't wait to try the next two crafts. Going to get a growler of amber and black heart to go home with.

data.title: Karaoke Night!
data.text: I went here with a few friends for Tuesday karaoke night. We sat on the patio and listened to hits from the 80s. One of my friends was bold enough to lip sync. I wasn't. I'm not a big beer drinker, but I had fun anyway.

data.title: Great patio
data.text: My wife and I ordered four total pints. The beers were malty in character with solid complexity. The beers seemed to stay away from extreme hoppiness which was a nice option for a brewpub of that size. We ordered food from the Italian place across the street and ate on a lovely patio for the winter cool weather.

data.title: awesome
data.text: great place, great brew come take the tour, lots of fun and educational, you will love it and never want to leave

data.title: Great spot with fantastic owner/operators.
data.text: Great location close to several casinos. Beer is top notch and all workers are friendly and informative.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: We just moved from CO and this is right up my alley. Great beer. Great atmosphere and a food truck. Done!! I love light beer and found the 6 of Hearts Ale was light and refreshing.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: Awesome beer, relaxing/fun atmosphere, friendly and genuine owners and staff! With the food trucks and L'Italiano across the street there is a choice to dine as well!

data.title: Great beer and fun local joint
data.text: Yummy beer, we tried several different beers from their brewery.   We tend to stick to ales and theirs were good but we ventured out and tried their milk maid Stout and it has a coffee finish it was very good.   They had karaoke the night we went and we're raising money for a local charity which was great for us as we enjoy both.  If your passing thru this area or visiting it is a great place to spend some time.

data.title: About Time
data.text: This place is just what Bossier City needed. Flying Heart offers great beer in a unique setting. The outside seating area is shaded by a large tree and is very comfortable in the evening. We got food from a vending truck just outside the brewery. Highly recommend and will visit often.

data.title: Amazingly smooth
data.text: This was a great place to relax, unwind and taste some of their home-brewed goodies!  We rode our motorcycles and enjoyed it on the front patio.

data.title: Brewing with Heart
data.text:
Ok.....well one of the Surgeons I work with and I were talking about the breweries here in our area. She mentioned that she had not been to the Flying Heart Brewery yet, so I said I'd go and check it out since i had not as well.
I looked the address up and to my suprise I knew the address, but not as the brewery. I made my way to Bossier City and onto Traffic St. And then onto Barksdale Blvd. This used to be Bossier City Fire Station No. 6 next to the old city hall and across the street from a nice little Italian restaurant " Lil Italiano ." 
The atmosphere is open air with tables and chairs in the main bays and out on the driveway. If you are there when the Fire truck and Firemen who served this location is traveling back to their new location, they blow the fire truck horn and wave. I've been there several times and each time this was a happening. They have fans running for the heat of our area and a cold beer makes it better. There are food truck for your dining fares and of course you can order appetizers from the Italian restaurant across the street.
The beers at Flying Heart are not very hopsy, but smooth. I have 2 favorites from their 6 or 7 beers offered. The Clementine Shandy is great if you like oranges and their Milk Stout is wonderful.
They have a Firehouse beer that is nice and a few others I've tried. I enjoyed every beer they have at Flying Heart even though I'm unable to name them all at the present. The Brewers put their hearts and passion into brewing a wonderful assortment of liquid refreshment.
It would be a wise choice to go visit this brewery in Bossier City.
They are open about 4p on Fridays and earlier on Saturdays.

owner_response.author: Jennifer M, Public Relations Manager at Flying Heart Brewing, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for such a great review.    We are so happy you were pleased with the experience.  Come again soon.   New seasonal beers are rolling out now.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awesome hang out
data.text: Love it, completely! Well, it is a bit hot during the dog days of these Louisiana summers. But it is an awesome place to gather, hang-out have a few beers. Especially like the Shandi. Great service and atmosphere. A must see!

data.title: Love the beer and atmosphere
data.text: We went for date night and loved the hospitality, beer selection and the food truck was awesome! They had us feel right at home even though it was our first visit! We purchased a big bottle of their Amber to take home. We will return

owner_response.author: Jennifer M, Manager at Flying Heart Brewing, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind review.  We are so glad you enjoyed your experience with us.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Well-crafted beer in a fun, laid-back atmosphere: A Must Visit
data.text: Flying Heart Brewery is my new favorite North Louisiana hangout. I stuck with the dark beers and they were beautifully smooth. The Black Heart has phenomenal layers of flavor. This is the real deal. The atmosphere is lively and fun. The night we were there, a food truck was on location. We didn't try the food, but you can't beat a good beer and food truck. I really like the token system, as well. Best thing to happen to the Bossier-Shreveport area in a long time! Flying Heart Brewery would be at ease in a far more urban environment and still works perfectly here. Good people, good times, great beer!

owner_response.author: Jennifer M, Manager at Flying Heart Brewing, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind words.  We are so glad you enjoyed your experience with us.  Please come back again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Group Meeting
data.text: Nice quant place, however, there is no air conditioning with the weather 96+, my husband drank his beer and we left!  He said beer was

owner_response.author: Jennifer M, Manager at Flying Heart Brewing, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Gail

I apologize for your dissatisfaction.  We are an open air venue.  We do have fans and cooling units to help with the Louisiana summer weather.    The renting group was aware of this when they booked our facility for the event..   Unfortunately, the event ended up being the hottest week of the summer.   Please come back in the fall when the weather has cooled some and I hope you have a more enjoyable experience.  

Thank you
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great time!
data.text: Great place for craft beer on tap! We had food from the local food truck on site and really enjoyed the atmosphere. Great place all around!

data.title: Excellent brews!
data.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my time at Flying Heart Brewing! The atmosphere was great and their Firehouse Blonde was one of my favorite beers made locally! They also had a food truck that served amazing hot dogs!
